headline: With Layoffs Spreading Across Industries, These Careers Are Still 'Doing Fine Right Now'—And Some Are Surprisingly Easy To Get Into
summary: Despite the wave of layoffs and hiring freezes hitting major sectors like tech, not every career path is suffering. A Reddit thread asking people what fields are “doing fine right now” received hundreds of replies; many of them from people currently working and thriving in those industries. Strong Demand Remains In Trades, Healthcare And Accounting Accountants were among the most confident responders. One person wrote, “I’m an accountant and I’m doing fine. I was able to cold-quit a job in July

headline: Mira Murati's Thinking Machines seeks $50 billion valuation in funding talks, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Some sources told Bloomberg that Thinking Machines ‍is looking at a valuation of about $50 billion, while others said it could rise to ​closer to $55 billion or $60 ‌billion.  Thinking Machines did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.  The development follows a ⁠Wall Street Journal report last ​month that said Andrew ​Tulloch, co-founder of Thinking Machines, left the AI company to ‍join Meta ⁠Platforms.

headline: Oracle Stock Is a Bet on OpenAI—and Investors are Cashing in There Chips
summary: Oracle  stock has given back all the gains from the cloud computing group’s “  Nvidia  Moment” as investors grow increasingly cautious over investments linked to the artificial intelligence boom.  When Oracle reported earnings in September, the results included a massive revenue forecast.  One of its biggest commitments is a reported $300 billion agreement to buy computing power for Oracle, and that deal represented around 65% of its so-called “RPO” forecast that sent the stock soaring in early September.

raw.headline: Oracle Stock Is a Bet on OpenAI—and Investors are Cashing in There Chips
raw.summary: Oracle  stock has given back all the gains from the cloud computing group’s “  Nvidia  Moment” as investors grow increasingly cautious over investments linked to the artificial intelligence boom.  When Oracle reported earnings in September, the results included a massive revenue forecast.  One of its biggest commitments is a reported $300 billion agreement to buy computing power for Oracle, and that deal represented around 65% of its so-called “RPO” forecast that sent the stock soaring in early September.

headline: RWE's first project in Louisiana completes construction
summary: RWE has completed construction of its first project in Louisiana, the 100 MW Lafitte Solar project located in the Ouachita Parish, outside of Monroe. The project will be fully online and generating energy by the end of the year. Lafitte Solar was enabled through a long-term Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with Meta, through which Meta also receives all environmental benefits associated with the project, including RECs.

headline: Kevin O'Leary's Take on Gold: 'It's Not a Debate, It's Not a Johnny-Come-Lately, It's Not a Crypto, It's Not Something Where There's Still Skeptics'

While many investors opt for simple gold bars, the "Shark Tank" investor takes his strategy a step further: He holds vintage, collectible gold coins for a double play on value. headline: Tencent Posts 15% Revenue Jump, Sustaining Growth Without Splashy AI Bets
summary: The results underscore how Tencent can afford to take a more measured approach to AI development than many of its more aggressive rivals.  Unlike Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and ByteDance Ltd., which have plowed billions into AI infrastructure and product roll-outs, the Shenzhen company is focusing more on integrating the technology into its core money-making services including the social media platform WeChat and game publishing.

headline: Big Tech’s Climate Strategists Feeling Strain of AI Power Needs
summary: On the tech giant’s 500-acre campus in Redmond, Washington, teams began holding regular “triage” meetings to confront serious questions posed by the artificial intelligence boom: Where would the company find the gigawatts — just one gigawatt can power nearly 750,000 US homes — needed for data centers?  The AI discussions were “interesting and terrifying all at the same time,” said Brian Janous, who served until August 2023 as Microsoft’s vice president of energy.

headline: Alibaba Preps Big Revamp of Flagship AI App to Rival ChatGPT
summary: Alibaba plans to start by updating the existing “Tongyi” apps on iOS and Android and renaming them “Qwen,” after the company’s well-known AI model, people familiar with the matter said.  The end goal is to try and make Qwen a fully functioning AI agent, the people said, a prime objective for the industry both in the US and China.  Alibaba plans to eventually expand globally with an overseas version, the people said.

Alibaba plans to eventually expand globally with an overseas version, the people said.
